movies.title: Memories of My Childhood
movies.plot: Loosely based on Romanian author Ion Creanga's life as a child during the 1840s.Young schoolboy Ion is growing up fast in a provincial town of the Moldavia region of Romania.Local villagers call him "Nica a lui Stefan a Petrei".The film offers a detailed account of his childhood with special focus on the relationships between Ion and the various people in his life.The relationships between Ion as a child and his parents,friends,neighbors and teachers are described.The larger context of the Romanian rural social universe of the 19th century is also touched upon.Finally,the film shows Ion's coming-of-age from an innocent child growing up in an idyllic remote village to a rebellious adolescent dreaming of becoming a priest.
movies.simplePlot: Based on Ion Creanga's book, the story of a child from his childhood to his manhood.

biography.bio: Stefan Ciubotarasu was born on March 21, 1910 in Lipovat, Vaslui, Romania. He was an actor, known for Memories of My Childhood (1965), Forest of the Hanged (1965) and Porto-Franco (1962). He died on August 27, 1970 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Stefan Ciubotarasu

biography.bio: Ion Bocancea was born on February 7, 1951. He is an actor, known for Memories of My Childhood (1965) and Camera alba (1965).
biography.name: Ion Bocancea

actors.character: Nicä a lui Stefan a Petrei

biography.bio: Corina Constantinescu is an actress, known for Memories of My Childhood (1965), Cine va deschide usa? (1969) and Comoara din Vadul Vechi (1964).
biography.name: Corina Constantinescu

biography.bio: Emanoil Petrut was a graduate from the Theatre and Film Art Institute of Bucharest, Romania, and became a film leading man in the fifties while still a student. Even if he starred in so many Romanian and European films, he loved being on stage. His long lasting career with the National Theatre of Bucharest enabled Mimi Petrut to play various roles in the company of famed actors, and great stage directors. And it was in only one instance when Mimi Petrut was in the same movie with his nephew, actor-director Tudor Petrut, "Femeia din Ursa Mare", shot in 1981. From that family experience remains only one black and white picture... Emanoil Petrut passed away in 1983, a short time after his beloved wife, broadcaster Catinca Ralea Petrut. They left behind a legacy of a family of intellectuals that will influence their time, be it communist or otherwise.
biography.name: Emanoil Petrut

biography.bio: Nicolae Venias is an actor, known for Memories of My Childhood (1965), Michael the Brave (1970) and Stephen the Great - Vaslui 1475 (1975).
biography.name: Nicolae Venias

biography.bio: Eliza Petrachescu was born on June 15, 1911 in Vaslui, Romania. She was an actress, known for Lust for Gold (1974), Stone Wedding (1973) and Memories of My Childhood (1965). She died on March 4, 1977 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Eliza Petrachescu

biography.bio: Zoe Anghel Stanca is an actress, known for Memories of My Childhood (1965), L'affaire Protar (1956) and Tinerete fara batrînete (1968).

biography.bio: Mircea Constantinescu was born on December 18, 1904 in Ramnica Sarat, Romania. He was an actor, known for Memories of My Childhood (1965), Doua lozuri (1957) and Stefan Luchian (1981). He died on March 6, 1972 in Bucuresti, Romania.
biography.name: Mircea Constantinescu

biography.bio: Costache Sava is an actor, known for Memories of My Childhood (1965) and Glissando (1982).

biography.bio: Ion Henter is an actor, known for Memories of My Childhood (1965), O scrisoare pierduta (1954) and Stephen the Great - Vaslui 1475 (1975).
biography.name: Ion Henter

biography.bio: Mihai Mereuta was born on November 29, 1924 in Santa Mare, Botosani, Romania. He was an actor, known for Ora zero (1979), Iancu Jianu, zapciul (1980) and The Punishment (1976). He died on April 1, 2003 in Bucharest, Romania.
biography.name: Mihai Mereuta

biography.bio: Maria Cupcea is an actress, known for Sarutul (1965), Memories of My Childhood (1965) and Citadela sfarîmata (1957).
biography.name: Maria Cupcea

biography.bio: Nunuta Hodos was born in the famous Hodos family of Transylvania, known for its scholars and political personalities, as Simeon Balint, Iosif Hodos, Alexandru Papiu Ilarian, Ilarie Chendi, Axente Sever, Nerva Hodos, Ion Gorun, and many others. She was also the maternal grand-aunt of the Romanian director and writer Mihnea Columbeanu, and an aunt of the Romanian actress Ana-Maria Nicolau. She was married to Constantin Toneanu, and they had a daughter, Rodica (1920-1968). She acted in several Romanian theaters, reaching the highest peak of her career in Brasov, where one of her most successful parts was Adela, the rich businesswoman in Horia Lovinescu's drama "Citadela sfärâmatä" ("The Crushed Citadel"). In cinema, she was specialized in powerful cameos, being able to build up convincing and meaty characters by using barely a few expressive lines and actions. All her roles were contributing with humor and veracity to the general picture, and she was much liked and respected by the directors and other cast and crew, being also a very funny and charismatic person - the perpetual "granny type", always ready with a snappy joke or wise word. She died in Bucharest, aged 84, almost ten years after her last role.
biography.name: Nunuta Hodos

biography.bio: Eduard Bulgaru is an actor, known for Memories of My Childhood (1965).
biography.name: Eduard Bulgaru

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Won Grand Prix Osso Pardo Asturiano
